item.description: Biography I, Amartya Sanyal, have graduated from IIT Kanpur with a B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering and am going to join The University of Oxford from Oxford, 2017. For this position. I am going to be funded by THe Alan Turing Institute during this endeavour of mine. I will be supervised by Prof. Varun Kanade and Prof. Phil Torr during the period. During the summers, I will be interning in the Cortex group of twitter under the mentorship of Nicholas Koumchatzky, who heads the Twitter Cortex group.

item.title: Visits
item.description: I have had the opportunity to visit a few places and carry out my research there. Here is a list of the places and what it is that I have mainly worked on during those visits. Computer Vision And Pattern Recognition Unit, ISI Kolkata - A hybrid architecture for face recignition in real life scenario. Machine Learning Team, Amazon.com Worked on a competitive pricing model. Montreal Institute of Learning Algorithms Worked on a novel Multiscale Language Model with a learned dictionary.

item.title: Agent based simulation of evolution of society as an alternate maximization problem
Multiscale sequence modeling with a learned dictionary
A Hybrid Deep Architecture for Face Recognition in Real-Life Scenario
NonConvexity of neural networks
item.description: I don’t remember where I heard this arguement but it was a pretty interesting one and I couldn’t remember the entire reasoning and so as I began to think about it, I figured some of it out and I believe it is pretty reasonable. We have all argued that neural networks are difficult to optimize because they are non-convex(or non-concave) for that matter. What we don’t talk about so much is why is it that they are non-convex.

item.title: Strong Convexity and Strong Smoothness
item.description: I am going to , inspired by the course on optimization that I am doing this semester, talk a bit about strong convexity and strong smoothness and our very popular gradient descent works on them. So, before going right into the details let’s have a quick chat about convexity in general and we do have a few ways of going about it. I will go about with talking about two definitions of convex functions, the first one being general more than the second.

item.title: The Cemetery of the mind!
item.description: Potato He had always been there. In the dark and wet soil waited he, For going out to the lighter place. He did hear about it from his crawling friend. But he couldn’t move and so he waited Once in a while drenched when it rained And sometimes dried to a pulp But he survived though all this, For his mother piped down whatever he needed. One fine day, there was a tug

item.title: Optimizing Non-decomposable Measures with Deep Networks
